tit.e: Tenjobito/Uebito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace)
Tenjobito/Uebito (a high-ranking courtier allowed into the Imperial Palace)

sen.j: 殿上人（てんじょうびと / うえびと）は、日本の官制において五位以上の者のうち、天皇の日常生活の場である清涼殿南廂へ昇ることを許された者のこと。
sen.e: In Japanese premodern government organization, Tenjobito was a court official of fifth rank or above who was permitted to enter the emperor's private living quarters, i.e., the south side of the emperor's residence Seiryoden.

Tenjobito/Uebito was a court official of fifth rank or above in Japanese pre-modern government organization and permitted to enter the emperor's private living quarters, i.e., the south side of the emperor's residence Seiryoden.

Tenjobito/Uebito was a court official of fifth rank or above in Japanese pre-modern government organization and permitted to enter the emperor's private living quarters, i.e., the south side of the emperor's residence Seiryoden.

sen.j: 清涼殿の殿上の間（ま）に昇ることを昇殿（しょうでん）と呼び、五位以上でない六位蔵人も例外的に昇殿を許され殿上人に含まれる。
sen.e: If an official below fifth rank (for example, a chamberlain of sixth rank) was extraordinary permitted to enter the courtiers' hall Tenjo No Ma in the emperor's residence, the official belonged to Tenjobito.

It is called "Shoden" (access to the imperial court) to climb up the Tenjo no ma (anteroom for nobles) in the emperor's residence, and if an official below fifth rank (for example, a chamberlain of sixth rank) was extraordinary permitted to enter the Tenjo No Ma, the official belonged to Tenjobito.
sen.cmt: 「清涼殿の殿上の間に昇ることを昇殿と呼び」訳漏れのため全文修正しました。
sen.e: The Japanese term "Shoden" means to enter the Tenjo no ma (anteroom for nobles) in the emperor's residence, and an official below the fifth rank (for example, a chamberlain of sixth rank) who was permitted to enter the Tenjo No Ma under exceptional circumstances belonged to Tenjobito.
sen.cmt: 「清涼殿の殿上の間に昇る」とありますが、climb upは物理的によじ登るの意味になると思われるので、単にenterとしました。climb up→enterextraordinary →exceptionally

sen.j: 殿上の名簿にその名を記されたため、仙籍ともいう。
sen.e: Tenjobito had their names registered in the court roster called 'Senseki', which also meant Tenjobito.

sen.j: 殿上人は昇殿許可に対して宿直（とのい）を命ぜられ、これに従う。
sen.e: Tenjobito was ordered to undertake the night duty in the Imperial Palace in exchange for the permission to enter the emperor's residence.

sen.j: 院や東宮の昇殿を許されたものも指す。
sen.e: Tenjobito included those who permitted to enter the ex-emperor's residence and the Crown Prince's residence.
Tenjobito included those who were permitted to enter the retired emperor's residence and the crown prince's residence.
sen.cmt: permitted を were permitted に修正しました。Ex-emperor を retired emperor に修正しました。Crown Prince's を crown prince's に修正しました。
sen.e: Tenjobito included those who were permitted to enter the retired emperor's residence and the crown prince's residence.

sen.j: 後代には近臣としての伺候を許されたものを指すようになるが、いずれも天皇や院、東宮の一代限りであり、代替わりにあたっては殿上人の身分を失った。
sen.e: Later, Tenjobito began to mean those who were permitted to wait on the emperor as trusted vessel; whichever the meaning, the privilege was untransferable and only effective until the emperor, ex-emperor, or crown prince changed.

sen.j: このため、再び昇殿するには再勅許が必要であった。
sen.e: Therefore, when the privilege ended, the nobles needed to have the imperial permission anew to enter the emperor's residence.
